refnamediv.refpurpose: Parse a URL and return its components

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
This function returns an associative array containing any of the various components of the URL that are present. If one of them is missing, no entry will be created for it. The components are :
scheme - e.g. http
host
port
user
pass
path
query - after the question mark ?
fragment - after the hashmark #
This function is not meant to validate the given URL, it only breaks it up into the above listed parts. Partial URLs are also accepted, parse_url tries its best to parse them correctly.

note.para: This function doesn't work with relative URLs.

example.title: parse_url example
example.screen:
$ php -r 'print_r( parse_url("http://username:password@hostname/path?arg=value#anchor"));' Array ( [scheme] => http [host] => hostname [user] => username [pass] => password [path] => /path [query] => arg=value [fragment] => anchor )
$ php -r 'print_r( parse_url("http://invalid_host..name/"));' Array ( [scheme] => http [host] => invalid_host..name [path] => / )

refsect1.para: See also pathinfo, parse_str, dirname, and basename.
